comments: "Truncating just before the unexpectedly large partial quotient 16,539 gives a famous approximation of Ramanujan for Pi^4 of 97 9/22." (Wells)
references: David Wells, "The Penguin Dictionary of Curious and Interesting Numbers," Revised Edition, Penguin Books, London, England, 1997, page 116.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
prog: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 21000); x=contfrac(Pi^4); for (n=0, 20000, write("b058286.txt", n, " ", x[n+1])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 22 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A092425 Decimal expansion. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 22 2009
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 07 2000
